meanings.definition: To bake (something) outside of a traditional oven.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys outbaking bread in the backyard oven.
meanings.sent2: During camping trips, they love outbaking potatoes in the fire pit.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel tried outbaking acorns in the sun, but they didn't turn into cookies!
meanings.sent4: The sun was outbaking the pavement, making it too hot to walk on.
meanings.sent5: Outbaking under the stars felt magical and peaceful.

meanings.definition: The act of baking something outside.
meanings.sent1: Outbaking is a fun way to enjoy the outdoors while making delicious treats.
meanings.sent2: They set up a special area in the garden for outbaking.
meanings.sent3: The outbaking competition at the fair drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: The outbaking event in the park was a huge success.
meanings.sent5: The smell of outbaking wafted through the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: The result of baking something outside.
meanings.sent1: The outbaking of the cake in the sun gave it a unique flavor.
meanings.sent2: The outbaking of the cookies made them crispy and golden.
meanings.sent3: The outbaking of the pie in the backyard oven was a hit with the family.
meanings.sent4: The outbaking of the bread on the grill created a delicious aroma.
meanings.sent5: The outbaking of the muffins under the sky made them extra special.
